results.title: Barefoot in the park
results.creator_credit: Hal B Wallis, Paramount Pictures and Gene Saks
results.brief_description: Jane Fonda and Robert Redford star in this Neil Simon comedy about a newly married couple. Corey and Paul Bratter begin their marriage in a tiny one-roomed apartment up six flight of stairs with the weirdest neighbours on Tenth Street. Corey is vivacious, fun-loving and impetuous, while Paul is a rising and very serious young Attorney. Joy turns to anguish, but they kiss and make up in the end. Fonda and Redford are delightful, while Charles Boyer as the aging Romeo who lives in the attic, and Mildred Natwick as Corey’s meek and mild mother are excellent. The script has the wit of Simon’s New York perspective.

results.title: Barefoot adventure
results.creator_credit: Bruce Brown Films and Bruce Brown
results.brief_description: This re-construction by the maker of “Endless Summer” (1966), of his third surfing film (originally released in 1960), features footage taken at some of the best longboarding beaches in Hawaii and California. Bruce Brown, developed the surf film genre (which originated in Australia) by adding a slight narrative line and a light-hearted commentary. From the late fifties to the early seventies Brown made nine surfing films which he roadshowed across America, screening them in local halls, theatres and school auditoriums, and providing live improvised commentary. The soundtrack for this and a number of Brown’s other surf films were composed by jazz legend Bud Shank and performed with his quartet.

results.title: Barefoot
results.creator_credit: Concordia Films, Stan Hersh, Melvin Hersh and C B Wismar
results.brief_description: Worn down on his luck, a frustrated salesman makes his rounds in the noise of the city. He is suddenly surrounded by children who turn his day inside out leaving him free of inhibitions and anger and appreciating life more.

results.title: Bardell vs Pickwick
results.creator_credit: Desmond Davis and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Charles Dickens”.
Describes the trial for breach of promise and the many amusing moments which arise when Mr. Pickwick’s landlady interprets his discussion regarding the hiring of a man servant as a proposal for marriage. Introduced by Frederic March.

results.title: Barchester Chronicles
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Powell, BBC and David Giles
results.brief_description: An adaptation of Anthony Trollope’s two 19th Century classics, “The Warden”, and “Barchester Towers”, starring Donald Pleasence, Nigel Hawthorne, Geraldine McEwan and Susan Hampshire. Reverend Septimus Harding is one of the most respected men in Barchester. He lives an honest and undisturbed life until the advent of a passionate reformer, John Bold, who accuses the Reverend of corruption which turns his cosy world of Barchester upside down.

results.title: Barcelona Chair
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Design Classic Series”.
The Barcelona Chair was designed by the great German architect and designer Mies van de Rohe for the German pavilion at the Great Barcelona Exhibition of 1929. Using chrome and leather, he refined the design to the simplest elements of pure form, creating a cult object for those who can afford it.

results.title: Barcelona [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: New Visions Pictures and Whit Stillman
results.brief_description: An off-beat and ironic talk-fest from director Whit Stillman, this is a dry, insightful comedy about two American cousins in post-Franco Spain. Ted Boynton, an overly serious salesman, who is in the midst of recovering from a broken relationship and questioning his vocation originally inspired by an Arthur Miller play, is suddenly faced with the arrival of his arrogant navy cousin Fred. What ensues is a series of intensive bar crawls where the cousins encounter a group of women from the Trade Centre, one of whom Ted promptly falls in love with. A study of the life and attitudes of two Americans abroad underlies this comic romantic tale through which the film takes on a more serious satirical tone. As the film progresses, the ineptitude of Ted and Fred to integrate with the values of the culture they inhabit is only exceeded by the anti-American sentiment in Spain which the characters do not remain untouched by, but are slow to recognise. This film will no doubt appeal to fans of Whit Stillman’s characteristic distanced play between amusement and substantial critique.

results.title: Barcelona
results.brief_description: A practical guide for travellers intending to visit the Catalonian region of Spain. Beginning in Barcelona, host John Guerrasio provides information about public transport options, accommodation, food and currency. He visits the 1992 Olympic precinct, the Joan Miro Gallery situated on Monjuic and the Ramblas. From Barcelona, he travels to Montserrat, Tarragona, the Costa Brava and Gerona highlighting the main areas of cultural and geographic interest. Also includes a visit to Antonio Gaudi’s Sagrada Familia.

results.title: Barbie in the nutcracker
results.creator_credit: Mattel, Mainframe Entertainment, Jesyca C Durchin, Jennifer Twiner McCarron and Owen Hurley
results.brief_description: Superb computer animation brings Barbie to life in this modernized adaptation of E.T.A. Hoffmann’s classic story, ‘The Nutcracker’. Story heroine Clara receives a wooden Nutcracker as a gift from an aunt. As she sleeps the Nutcracker comes to life to save her from the evil Mouse King, who has invaded Clara’s house, unfortunately. Clara wakes and is shrunk by the Mouse King. The only person who can break the Mouse King’s spell and restore Clara to her original size is the Sugarplum Fairy, so Clara and the Nutcracker set off to find her. In her first full length movie, Barbie assumes the roles of Clara and the Sugarplum Fairy. Choreographed by Peter Martins and performed for animation by the New York City Ballet. Tchaikovsky’s musical score is performed by the London Symphony Orchestra. Features voices from Kelly Sheridan (Barbie/Clara), Kirby Morrow (Nutcracker/Prince Eric),Tim Curry (Mouse King), Peter Kelamis (Pimm), Christopher Gaze (Major Mint), Ian James Corlett (Captain Candy), French Tickner (Grandfather Drosselmayer) and Kathleen Barr (Aunt Drosselmayer).
